1.title: Israel & Palestine
1.plot: Israel and Palestine is about three generations of women who took and take up arms in Israel and Palestine. From the first female hijacker, to the young Tamimi girls and Israeli soldiers on the other side of the wall: how do they look back at their choice for armed fight and how they see the future? Do they regret their choices for armed resistance? And what is the outcome of their choice, was it all worth it?

2.title: Colombia
2.plot: The Colombia episode focuses on women who were with FARC and are now demobilizing and on the verge of reintegrating into society. How does one go back to society when she spent 15 years in the jungle? How does one survive the forced adoption of her own daughter?

3.title: Iraq
3.plot: The Iraq episode evolves around female fighters in Northern Iraq, where they are trained within the ideology of PKK. Famous over the world for their brave fight against Isis, these women have more projects: changing society, politics and aiming for a female revolution in Kurdistan.

imdb.plot outline: Amazons is a documentary series about women who take up arms. Phara de Aguirre meets armed women all around the world: from FARC fighters in Colombia, to female PKK fighters and Peshmerga in Iraqi Kurdistan, to three generations of armed women on both sides of the wall in Israel and Palestine: top terrorist and hijacker Leila Khaled, Ahed Tamimi, female Israeli soldiers, all of them with their own story.
imdb.title: Amazones
plot: Amazons is a documentary series about women who take up arms. Phara de Aguirre meets armed women all around the world: from FARC fighters in Colombia, to female PKK fighters and Peshmerga in Iraqi Kurdistan, to three generations of armed women on both sides of the wall in Israel and Palestine: top terrorist and hijacker Leila Khaled, Ahed Tamimi, female Israeli soldiers, all of them with their own story.::Nahid Shaikh
